member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.Assert.Async
member.summary: Instruct QUnit to wait for an asynchronous operation. When your test has any asynchronous exit points, call assert.async() to get a unique resolution callback for each async operation. The callback returned from assert.async() will throw an Error if is invoked more than once.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.Assert.Equal(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: A non-strict comparison, roughly equivalent to JUnit's assertEquals.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.Assert.Equal(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: A non-strict comparison, roughly equivalent to JUnit's assertEquals.
member.param: A short description of the assertion

member.param: A short description of the assertion

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.Assert.Expect(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify how many assertions are expected to run within a test. If the number of assertions run does not match the expected count, the test will fail.
member.param: Number of assertions in this test.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Result
member.summary: The boolean result of an assertion, true means passed, false means failed.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Actual
member.summary: One side of a comparision assertion. Can be undefined when ok() is used.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Expected
member.summary: One side of a comparision assertion. Can be undefined when ok() is used.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Message
member.summary: A string description provided by the assertion.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Source
member.summary: The associated stacktrace, either from an exception or pointing to the source of the assertion. Depends on browser support for providing stacktraces, so can be undefined.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Module
member.summary: The test module name of the assertion. If the assertion is not connected to any module, the property's value will be undefined.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Name
member.summary: The test block name of the assertion.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs.Runtime
member.summary: The time elapsed in milliseconds since the start of the containing Test(), including setup.

member.name: T:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit
member.summary: When integrating QUnit into other tools like CI servers, use these callbacks as an API to read test results.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Begin(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.TestSuiteBeginCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever the test suite begins. It is called once before running any tests.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Done(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.TestSuiteDoneCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever the test suite ends.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Log(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.AssertLogCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever an assertion completes.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.ModuleDone(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.ModuleDoneCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever a module ends.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.ModuleStart(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.ModuleStartCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever a module begins.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.TestDone(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.TestDoneCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever a test ends.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.TestStart(System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.TestStartCallbackArgs})
member.summary: Register a callback to fire whenever a test begins.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Extend(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Copy the properties defined by the mixin object into the target object. This method will modify the target object to contain the "own" properties defined by the mixin. If the mixin object specifies the value of any attribute as undefined, this property will instead be removed from the target object.
member.param: An object whose properties are to be modified.
An object describing which properties should be modified.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Config
member.summary: Configuration for QUnit.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Dump
member.summary: Advanced and extensible data dumping for JavaScript.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Module(System.String)
member.summary: Group related tests under a single label.
member.param: Label for this group of tests

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Module(System.String,Bridge.QUnit.ModuleHooks)
member.summary: Group related tests under a single label.
member.param: Label for this group of tests
Callbacks to run before and after each test

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Skip(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a test like object to be skipped.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Start
member.summary: Start running tests again after the testrunner was stopped. The method must be used to start a test run that has QUnit.config.autostart set to false.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.QUnit.Test(System.String,System.Action{Bridge.QUnit.Assert})
member.summary: Add a test to run. The assert argument to the callback contains all of QUnit's assertion methods. Use this argument to call your test assertions.

member.name: T:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration for QUnit

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Altertitle
member.summary: By default, QUnit runs tests when load event is triggered on the window. If you're loading tests asynchronously, you can set this property to false, then call QUnit.start() once everything is loaded.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Autostart
member.summary: By default, QUnit runs tests when load event is triggered on the window. If you're loading tests asynchronously, you can set this property to false, then call QUnit.start() once everything is loaded.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Current
member.summary: This object isn't actually a configuration property, but is listed here anyway, as its exported through QUnit.config. This gives you access to some QUnit internals at runtime.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Hidepassed
member.summary: By default, the HTML Reporter will show all the tests results. Enabling this option will make it show only the failing tests, hiding all that pass. This can also be managed by the HTML interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.ModuleFilter
member.summary: Specify a single module to run by declaring its name. By default, QUnit will run all the loaded modules when this property is not specified. This property value must match (case insensitive) the module name or QUnit won't run any module. Prior to version 1.16.0, this property was called module.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Reorder
member.summary: By default, QUnit will run tests first that failed on a previous run. In a large testsuite, this can speed up testing a lot. It can also lead to random errors, in case your testsuite has non-atomic tests, where the order is important. You should fix those issues, instead of disabling reordering!

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.RequireExpects
member.summary: The expect() method is optional by default, though it can be useful to require each test to specify the number of expected assertions. Enabling this option will cause tests to fail, if they don't call expect() at all.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.TestId
member.summary: This property allows QUnit to run specific test blocks by a hashed string combining their module name and test name. You can specify one or multiple tests to run.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.TestTimeout
member.summary: Specify a global timeout in milliseconds after which all tests will fail with an appropriate message. Useful when async tests aren't finishing, to prevent the testrunner getting stuck. Set to something high, e.g. 30000 (30 seconds) to avoid slow tests to time out by accident.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.Scrolltop
member.summary: By default, scroll to top of the page when suite is done. Setting this to false will leave the page scroll alone.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Configuration.UrlConfig
member.summary: This property controls which form controls to put into the QUnit toolbar element (below the header). By default, the "noglobals" and "notrycatch" checkboxes are there. By extending this array, you can add your own checkboxes and select lists. Each element should be an object with an id property (used as the config and query-string key) and a label property (used as text in the UI), and optionally a tooltip property (used as the title attribute to explain what the control does). Each element should also have a value property controlling available options and rendering. If value is undefined, the option will render as a checkbox. The corresponding URL parameter will be set to "true" when the checkbox is checked, and otherwise will be absent. If value is a string, the option will render as a checkbox. The corresponding URL parameter will be set to the string when the checkbox is checked, and otherwise will be absent. If value is an array, the option will render as a select-one with an empty first option, followed by an option for each element of the array, with text and value matching the element. The corresponding URL parameter will be absent when the empty option is selected, and otherwise will be set to the value of the selected array element. If value is an object, the option will render as a select-one with an empty first option, followed by an option for each property of the object, with text and value matching the name and value (respectively) of the property. The corresponding URL parameter will be absent when the empty option is selected, and otherwise will be set to the value of the selected object property.

member.name: T:Bridge.QUnit.Dump
member.summary: Advanced and extensible data dumping for JavaScript.

member.name: M:Bridge.QUnit.Dump.Parse(System.Object)
member.summary: This method does string serialization by parsing data structures and objects. It parses DOM elements to a string representation of their outer HTML. By default, nested structures will be displayed up to five levels deep. Anything beyond that is replaced by [object Object] and [object Array] placeholders.

member.name: F:Bridge.QUnit.Dump.MaxDepth
member.summary: Representing how deep the elements should be parsed by Dump(object data).

member.name: T:Bridge.QUnit.ModuleHooks
member.summary: You can specify code to run before and after each test using the hooks argument, and also to create properties that will be shared on the context of each test. Any additional properties on the hooks object will be added to that context.

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.ModuleHooks.BeforeEach
member.summary: Runs before each test

member.name: P:Bridge.QUnit.ModuleHooks.AfterEach
member.summary: Runs after each test
